message.example: Ensure all required parameters are passed
Ensure you are using a valid API key
Could not find item based on query parameters
Your rate limit has been exceeded
An unexpected response was received from the backend.

description.example: The Ape Society is a collection of 7,000 NFTs generated on the Cardano blockchain.
LENFI is a utility token integral to a decentralized lending and borrowing protocol on the Cardano blockchain

ApiAuthKey.description: Contact TapTools to get an API key
ApiAuthKey.name: x-api-key

info.description:
TapTools is a data provider that offers onchain data for assets on the Cardano network.

# Introduction
This API includes many of the same endpoints that power the [TapTools website](https://taptools.io).
We have indexed onchain market data for both fungible and non-fungible tokens, as well as
included endpoints to query raw onchain data.

# Rate Limiting
This API implements rate limiting to ensure resources aren't overwhelmed. This rate limit varies by plan.
info.title: TapTools - API Documentation

get.description: Get address payment credential and stake address, along with its current aggregate lovelace and multi asset balance. Either `address` or `paymentCred` can be provided, but one must be provided.

parameters.description: Address to query for
parameters.name: address

parameters.description: Payment credential to query for
parameters.name: paymentCred

get.description: Get current UTxOs at an address/payment credential. Either `address` or `paymentCred` can be provided, but one must be provided.

parameters.description: Address to query for
parameters.name: address

parameters.description: Payment credential to query for
parameters.name: paymentCred

parameters.description: This endpoint supports pagination. Default page is `1`.
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Specify how many items to return per page. Maximum is `100`, default is `100`.
parameters.name: perPage

get.description: Get onchain supply for a token.

parameters.description: Token unit (policy + hex name) to filter by

parameters.description: Token ID

parameters.description: Limit results to a maximum count, Defaults to `1000`, With a maximum of `1000`.

Returns pair details (aka pool) by its address.

get.description: Get aggregated market stats, including 24h DEX volume and total active addresses onchain. Active addresses are addresses that have either sent or received any transactions within the last 24 hours. Multiple addresses with the same stake key will be counted as one address.

parameters.description: Quote currency to use (ADA, USD, EUR, ETH, BTC). Default is `ADA`.
parameters.name: quote

get.description: Get the number of requests made by day over the last 30d.
Get a specific asset's sale history.

parameters.description: The policy ID for the collection.
parameters.name: policy

parameters.description: The name of a specific NFT to get stats for.
parameters.name: name

get.description: Get high-level stats on a certain NFT asset.

parameters.description: The policy ID for the collection.
parameters.name: policy

parameters.description: The name of a specific NFT to get stats for.
parameters.name: name

get.description: Get a specific NFT's traits and trait prices.

parameters.description: The policy ID for the collection.
parameters.name: policy

parameters.description: The name of a specific NFT to get stats for.
parameters.name: name

parameters.description: Include trait prices or not, Options are `0`, `1`. Default is `1`.
parameters.name: prices

get.description:
Get all NFTs from a collection with the ability to sort by price/rank and filter to specific traits.
Categories and traits can be searched for by adding query params ex:(`policy=abc&hair=white,black&background=red`),
you can have any combination of categories and traits ex:(`policy=abc&hair=blonde&background=blue`)

parameters.description: The policy ID for the collection.
parameters.name: policy

parameters.description: What should the results be sorted by. Options are `price` and `rank`. Default is `price`.
parameters.name: sortBy

parameters.description: Which direction should the results be sorted. Options are `asc`, `desc`. Default is `asc`
parameters.name: order

parameters.description: Search for a certain NFT's name, default is `null`.
parameters.name: search

parameters.description: Return only nfts that are on sale Options are `0`, `1`. Default is `0`.
parameters.name: onSale

parameters.description: This endpoint supports pagination. Default page is `1`.
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Specify how many items to return per page. Maximum is `100`, default is `100`.
parameters.name: perPage

get.description: Get the distribution of NFTs within a collection by bucketing into number of NFTs held groups. This counts someone who has an asset listed on a marketplace as an owner, as well as someone who is staking their NFT to a supported smart contract.

parameters.description: The policy ID for the collection.
parameters.name: policy

get.description: Get the top holders for a particular NFT collection. This counts someone who has an asset listed on a marketplace as an owner, as well as someone who is staking their NFT to a supported smart contract.

parameters.name: policy

parameters.description: This endpoint supports pagination. Default page is `1`.

parameters.name: perPage

parameters.description: Whether or not to exclude marketplace addresses (0, 1)
parameters.name: excludeExchanges

get.description: Get holders trended by day for a particular NFT collection. This counts someone who has an asset listed on a marketplace as an owner, as well as someone who is staking their NFT to a supported smart contract.

parameters.description: The policy ID for the collection.
parameters.name: policy

parameters.description: The time interval. Options are `7d`, `30d`, `90d`, `180d`, `1y` and `all`. Defaults to `30d`.
parameters.name: timeframe

parameters.description: The policy ID for the collection.
parameters.name: policy

parameters.description: The policy ID for the collection.
parameters.name: policy

parameters.description: The policy ID for the collection.
parameters.name: policy

parameters.description: Specify how many items to return. Maximum is `1000`, default is `500`.
parameters.name: items

get.description: Get a list of active listings with supporting information. This endpoint supports pagination and sorting by price and time listed.

parameters.description: The policy ID for the collection.
parameters.name: policy

parameters.description: What should the results be sorted by. Options are `price`, `time`. Default is `price`.
parameters.name: sortBy

parameters.description: Which direction should the results be sorted. Options are `asc`, `desc`. Default is `asc`
parameters.name: order

parameters.description: This endpoint supports pagination. Default page is `1`.
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Specify how many items to return per page. Maximum is `100`, default is `100`.
parameters.name: perPage

get.description: Get trended number of listings and floor price for a particular NFT collection.

parameters.description: The policy ID for the collection.
parameters.name: policy

parameters.description: The time interval. Options are `3m`, `5m`, `15m`, `30m`, `1h`, `2h`, `4h`, `12h`, `1d`, `3d`, `1w`, `1M`.
parameters.name: interval

parameters.description: The number of intervals to return, e.g. if you want 180 days of data in 1d intervals, then pass `180` here. Leave blank for full history.
parameters.name: numIntervals

get.description: Get OHLCV (open, high, low, close, volume) of floor price for a particular NFT collection. If you don't plan to format with candlesticks, you can use the `close` value from each interval and create a simple line chart. `time` is the start time of the interval, as a UNIX timestamp.

parameters.description: The policy ID for the collection.
parameters.name: policy

parameters.description: The time interval. Options are `3m`, `5m`, `15m`, `30m`, `1h`, `2h`, `4h`, `12h`, `1d`, `3d`, `1w`, `1M`.
parameters.name: interval

parameters.description: The number of intervals to return, e.g. if you want 180 days of data in 1d intervals, then pass `180` here.
parameters.name: numIntervals

get.description: Get basic information about a collection like floor price, volume, and supply. Volume returned is lifetime volume. Use `/nft/collection/trades/stats` for different timeframes and more information about trading volume.

parameters.description: The policy ID for the collection.
parameters.name: policy

get.description:
Get basic information about a collection like floor price, volume, and supply. Volume returned is lifetime volume.
`pctChg` values are the percentage difference between current values and value up until timeframe. This returns the
same data as `nft/collection/stats`, but with percent changes included.

parameters.description: The policy ID for the collection.
parameters.name: policy

parameters.description: The time interval. Options are `24h`, `7d`, `30d`. Defaults to `24h`.
parameters.name: timeframe

get.description: Get individual trades for a particular collection or for the entire NFT market by not specifying a policy ID.

parameters.description: The policy ID for the collection.
parameters.name: policy

parameters.description: The time interval. Options are `1h`, `4h`, `24h`, `7d`, `30d`, `90d`, `180d`, `1y`, `all`. Defaults to `30d`.
parameters.name: timeframe

parameters.description: What should the results be sorted by. Options are `amount`, `time`. Default is `time`.
parameters.name: sortBy

parameters.description: Which direction should the results be sorted. Options are `asc`, `desc`. Default is `desc`.
parameters.name: order

parameters.description: Filter to only trades of a certain ADA amount.
parameters.name: minAmount

parameters.description: Filter trades using a UNIX timestamp, will only return trades after this timestamp.
parameters.name: from

parameters.description: This endpoint supports pagination. Default page is `1`.
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Specify how many items to return per page. Maximum is `100`, default is `100`.
parameters.name: perPage

parameters.description: The time interval. Options are `3m`, `5m`, `15m`, `30m`, `1h`, `2h`, `4h`, `12h`, `1d`, `3d`, `1w`, `1M`.
parameters.name: interval

get.description: Get high-level market stats across the entire NFT market. `addresses` is the count of stake keys that have purchased or sold an NFT within the given timeframe. If an address does not have a stake key, it is still counted as a distinct address.

parameters.description: The time interval. Options are `1h`, `4h`, `24h`, `7d`, `30d`, `all`. Defaults to `24h`.
parameters.name: timeframe

get.description: Get high-level market stats across the entire NFT market. `addresses` is the count of stake keys that have purchased or sold an NFT within the given timeframe. If an address does not have a stake key, it is still counted as a distinct address.

parameters.description: The time interval. Options are `1h`, `4h`, `24h`, `7d`, `30d`, `all`. Defaults to `24h`.
parameters.name: timeframe

get.description: Get trended volume for entire NFT market.

parameters.description: The time interval. Options are `7d`, `30d`, `90d`, `180d`, `1y`, `all`. Defaults to `30d`.
parameters.name: timeframe

parameters.description: The time interval. Options are `24h`, `7d`, `30d`, `90d`, `180d`, `all`. Defaults to `7d`.

get.description: Get top NFT rankings based on total market cap, 24 hour volume or 24 hour top price gainers/losers.

parameters.name: ranking

parameters.description: Specify how many items to return. Maximum is `100`, default is `25`.
parameters.name: items

get.description: Get top NFT collections by trading volume over a given timeframe.

parameters.description: What timeframe to include in volume aggregation. Options are `1h`, `4h`, `24h`, `7d`, `30d`, `all`. Defaults to `24h`.
parameters.name: timeframe

parameters.description: This endpoint supports pagination. Default page is `1`.
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Specify how many items to return per page. Maximum is `100`, default is `10`.
parameters.name: perPage

get.description:
Get top NFT collections by trading volume over a given timeframe.
`pctChg` values are the percentage difference between current values and values up until the given `timeframe`.

parameters.description: What timeframe to include in volume aggregation. Options are `1h`, `4h`, `24h`, `7d`, `30d`, `all`. Defaults to `24h`.
parameters.name: timeframe

parameters.description: This endpoint supports pagination. Default page is `1`.
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Specify how many items to return per page. Maximum is `100`, default is `10`.
parameters.name: perPage

get.description: Get active P2P loans of a certain token (Currently only supports P2P protocols like Lenfi and Levvy).

parameters.description: Token unit (policy + hex name) to filter by
parameters.name: unit

parameters.description: Comma seperated value enabling you to filter to loans where token is used as `collateral`, `debt`, `interest` or a mix of them, default is `collateral,debt` filtering to loans where token is used as collateral OR debt.
parameters.name: include

parameters.description: What should the results be sorted by. Options are `time`, `expiration`. Default is `time`. `expiration` is expiration date of loan.
parameters.name: sortBy

parameters.description: Which direction should the results be sorted. Options are `asc`, `desc`. Default is `desc`.
parameters.name: order

parameters.description: This endpoint supports pagination. Default page is `1`.
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Specify how many items to return per page, default is `100`.
parameters.name: perPage

get.description: Get active P2P loan offers that are not associated with any loans yet (Currently only supports P2P protocols like Lenfi and Levvy).

parameters.description: Token unit (policy + hex name) to filter by
parameters.name: unit

parameters.description: Comma seperated value enabling you to filter to offers where token is used as `collateral`, `debt`, `interest` or a mix of them, default is `collateral,debt` filtering to offers where token is used as collateral OR debt.
parameters.name: include

parameters.description: What should the results be sorted by. Options are `time`, `duration`. Default is `time`. `duration` is loan duration in seconds.
parameters.name: sortBy

parameters.description: Which direction should the results be sorted. Options are `asc`, `desc`. Default is `desc`.
parameters.name: order

parameters.description: This endpoint supports pagination. Default page is `1`.
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Specify how many items to return per page, default is `100`.
parameters.name: perPage

get.description: Get total number of holders for a specific token. This uses `coalesce(stake_address, address)`, so all addresses under one stake key will be aggregated into 1 holder.

parameters.description: Token unit (policy + hex name)
parameters.name: unit

get.description: Get top token holders.

parameters.description: Token unit (policy + hex name)
parameters.name: unit

parameters.description: This endpoint supports pagination. Default page is `1`.
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Specify how many items to return per page. Maximum is `100`, default is `20`.
parameters.name: perPage

get.description: Get indicator values (e.g. EMA, RSI) based on price data for a specific token. There are multiple parameters that can be passed, but some only apply to certain indicators. This will return the most recent values.

parameters.description: Token unit (policy + hex name)
parameters.name: unit

parameters.description: The time interval. Options are `3m`, `5m`, `15m`, `30m`, `1h`, `2h`, `4h`, `12h`, `1d`, `3d`, `1w`, `1M`.
parameters.name: interval

parameters.description: The number of items to return. The maximum number of items that can be returned is 1000.
parameters.name: items

parameters.description: Specify which indicator to use. Options are `ma`, `ema`, `rsi`, `macd`, `bb`, `bbw`.
parameters.name: indicator

parameters.description: Length of data to include. Used in `ma`, `ema`, `rsi`, `bb`, and `bbw`.
parameters.name: length

parameters.description: Length of data to include for smoothing. Used in `ema`. Most often is set to 2.
parameters.name: smoothingFactor

parameters.description: Length of shorter EMA to use in MACD. Only used in `macd`
parameters.name: fastLength

parameters.description: Length of longer EMA to use in MACD. Only used in `macd`
parameters.name: slowLength

parameters.description: Length of signal EMA to use in MACD. Only used in `macd`
parameters.name: signalLength

parameters.description: Standard deviation multiplier to use for upper and lower bands of Bollinger Bands (typically set to 2). Used in `bb` and `bbw`.
parameters.name: stdMult

parameters.description: Which quote currency to use when building price data (e.g. `ADA`, `USD`).
parameters.name: quote

get.description: Get a specific token's social links, if they have been provided to TapTools.

parameters.description: Token unit (policy + hex name)
parameters.name: unit

get.description: Get a specific token's supply and market cap information. We pull circulating supply information from [this repo](https://github.com/minswap/market-cap).

parameters.description: Token unit (policy + hex name)
parameters.name: unit

200.description: Supply and market cap successfully returned

get.description: Get a specific token's trended (`open`, `high`, `low`, `close`, `volume`) price data. You can either pass a token unit to get aggregated data across all liquidity pools, or an `onchainID` for a specific pair (see `/token/pools`).

parameters.description: Token unit (policy + hex name)
parameters.name: unit

parameters.description: Pair onchain ID to get ohlc data for
parameters.name: onchainID

parameters.description: The time interval. Options are `3m`, `5m`, `15m`, `30m`, `1h`, `2h`, `4h`, `12h`, `1d`, `3d`, `1w`, `1M`.
parameters.name: interval

parameters.description: The number of intervals to return, e.g. if you want 180 days of data in 1d intervals, then pass `180` here.
parameters.name: numIntervals

get.description: Get a specific token's active liquidity pools. Can search for all token pools using `unit` or can search for specific pool with `onchainID`.

parameters.description: Token unit (policy + hex name)
parameters.name: unit

parameters.description: Liquidity pool onchainID
parameters.name: onchainID

parameters.description: Return only ADA pools or all pools (0, 1)
parameters.name: adaOnly

post.description: Get an object with token units (policy + hex name) as keys and price as values for a list of policies and hex names. These prices are aggregated across all supported DEXs. Max batch size is `100` tokens.

requestBody.description: List of policy + hex names of tokens.

get.description: Get a specific token's price percent change over various timeframes. Timeframe options include `[5m, 1h, 4h, 6h, 24h, 7d, 30d, 60d, 90d]`. All timeframes are returned by default.

parameters.description: Token unit (policy + hex name)
parameters.name: unit

parameters.description: List of timeframes
parameters.name: timeframes

get.description: Get current quote price (e.g, current ADA/USD price).

parameters.description: Quote currency to use (USD, EUR, ETH, BTC). Default is `USD`.
parameters.name: quote

get.description: Get all currently available quote currencies.
Get tokens ranked by their DEX liquidity. This includes both AMM and order book liquidity.

parameters.description: This endpoint supports pagination. Default page is `1`.
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Specify how many items to return per page. Maximum is `100`, default is `10`.
parameters.name: perPage

get.description: Get tokens with top market cap in a descending order. This endpoint does exclude deprecated tokens (e.g. MELD V1 since there was a token migration to MELD V2).

parameters.description: Sort tokens by circulating market cap or fully diluted value. Options `[mcap, fdv]`.
parameters.name: type

parameters.description: This endpoint supports pagination. Default page is `1`.
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Specify how many items to return per page. Maximum is `100`, default is `20`.
parameters.name: perPage

200.description: Top market cap tokens successfully returned

get.description: Get tokens with top volume for a given timeframe.

parameters.description: Specify a timeframe in which to aggregate the data by. Options are `[1h, 4h, 12h, 24h, 7d, 30d, 180d, 1y, all]`. Default is `24h`.
parameters.name: timeframe

parameters.description: This endpoint supports pagination. Default page is `1`.
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Specify how many items to return per page. Maximum is `100`, default is `20`.
parameters.name: perPage

get.description: Get token trades across the entire DEX market.

parameters.description: The time interval. Options are `1h`, `4h`, `24h`, `7d`, `30d`, `90d`, `180d`, `1y`, `all`. Defaults to `30d`.
parameters.name: timeframe

parameters.description: What should the results be sorted by. Options are `amount`, `time`. Default is `amount`. Filters to only ADA trades if set to `amount`.
parameters.name: sortBy

parameters.description: Which direction should the results be sorted. Options are `asc`, `desc`. Default is `desc`.
parameters.name: order

parameters.description: Optionally filter to a specific token by specifying a token unit (policy + hex name).
parameters.name: unit

parameters.description: Filter to only trades of a certain ADA amount.
parameters.name: minAmount

parameters.description: Filter trades using a UNIX timestamp, will only return trades after this timestamp.
parameters.name: from

parameters.description: This endpoint supports pagination. Default page is `1`.
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Specify how many items to return per page. Maximum is `100`, default is `10`.
parameters.name: perPage

get.description: Get aggregated trading stats for a particular token.

parameters.description: Token unit (policy + hex name)
parameters.name: unit

parameters.description: Specify a timeframe in which to aggregate the data by. Options are `[15m, 1h, 4h, 12h, 24h, 7d, 30d, 90d, 180d, 1y, all]`. Default is `24h`.
parameters.name: timeframe

get.description: Get UTxOs from a specific transaction.

parameters.description: Transaction hash
parameters.name: hash

get.description: Get wallet's current portfolio positions with supporting market data. This includes positions that are staked in a smart contract and LP farm positions (for supported protocols)

parameters.description: Address to query for
parameters.name: address

get.description: Get the token trade history for a particular wallet. Optionally pass a token unit to filter to a specific token.

parameters.description: Address to query for
parameters.name: address

parameters.description: Token unit (policy + hex name) to filter by
parameters.name: unit

get.description:
Get historical trended value of an address in 4hr intervals. 
This includes the value of all tokens, NFTs, LP/farm positions, custodial staking, and assets involved in active loans (either being lent or used as collateral).
**NOTE** this does not include staking rewards unless the rewards are withdrew from rewards account.

parameters.description: Address to query for
parameters.name: address

parameters.description: The time interval. Options are `24h`, `7d`, `30d`, `90d`, `180d`, `1y`, `all`. Defaults to `30d`.
parameters.name: timeframe

parameters.description: Quote currency to use (ADA, USD, EUR, ETH, BTC). Default is `ADA`.
parameters.name: quote
